Expressing the sense of Congress in support of a coordinated and effective international response to the crisis in Ukraine and in support of the use of reparations paid by Russia for Ukrainian recovery and reconstruction efforts while ensuring that, to the extent possible, the burden of funding Ukraine's reconstruction does not fall on United States taxpayers.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

bill.summary: This concurrent resolution expresses the sense that Russia bears responsibility for the financial burden of Ukraine's reconstruction and that the United States must utilize, to the fullest extent, the current cache of seized Russian assets for Ukrainian reconstruction. It calls on the President (1) to work internationally in response to the crisis, including the further imposition of sanctions; (2) to advocate for an international mechanism to determine the amount of reparations to be paid by Russia; and (3) to pressure Russia to pay those reparations.
